differential_diagnosis: Absence of reduced nicotinamide adenine dinucleotide methemoglobin-converting enzyme
Absence of glyceraldehyde-3-phosphate dehydrogenase, glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase, or pyruvate oxidase
Absence of glutathione reductase or glutathione peroxidase
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis of acatalasemia was confirmed through observation of markedly decreased erythrocyte catalase activity and the patient's response to hydrogen peroxide, which caused methemoglobinemia in the absence of normal catalase function. The family history indicated that the mother had hypocatalasemia, suggesting a genetic predisposition.
